meanings.definition: To equip or organize for military purposes.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers militarized their gear for the mission.
meanings.sent2: The country militarized its forces to defend its borders.
meanings.sent3: The picnic was militarized with camo tablecloths and canteens.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was militarized with strategic plans for success.
meanings.sent5: The playground was militarized with toy soldiers and tanks.

meanings.definition: To give a military character to.
meanings.sent1: The general militarized the training exercises for realism.
meanings.sent2: The movie director militarized the scenes with accurate uniforms.
meanings.sent3: The birthday party was militarized with a camouflage cake.
meanings.sent4: His voice was militarized with authority and command.
meanings.sent5: The garden was militarized with rows of soldier figurines.

meanings.sent1: The new policy militarized the school environment.
meanings.sent2: The harsh words militarized the conversation.
meanings.sent3: The fashion show was militarized with combat boots and helmets.
meanings.sent4: His demeanor was militarized with discipline and precision.
meanings.sent5: The storm clouds militarized the sky with a dark, ominous presence.
